blogPosts.title: Supremacy of Quantum Computers
blogPosts.content: Let’s say we have four playing cards. Each card differs from the others. After shuffling all four cards, one person asks to take the queen from those cards. He will pick cards one by one until he gets the queen card. So, at some point, he will get the queen card. This is how classical computers work. Classical computers are the computers that we use in our day-to-day lives. But quantum computers can find the queen only in one attempt. Whatever the number of cards, even within a million cards, quantum computers can find the queen with only one try. This shows how powerful they are.

blogPosts.title: SUPREMACY OF PRIVACY AND SECURITY IN THE DIGITAL ERA
blogPosts.content: Nowadays, everybody has the power to send and receive any form of data and information just by the click of a button. It can be text, audio, video, e-mail, etc. But nobody thinks about how all this data and information is sent to others without any leakage of information. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, more than 60% of commercial transactions are done online, demonstrating the critical need for high transaction security.

jobs.title: Intern – Software Engineer (SE)
jobs.description: This internship provides hands-on experience in software development, allowing you to work closely with senior engineers on real-world projects. You will contribute to application development, testing, and documentation while learning industry-standard tools and programming practices.
jobs.responsibilities:
Assist in designing, developing, and testing software applications.

Collaborate with the engineering team to implement new features.

Debug and resolve technical issues under supervision.

Participate in code reviews and follow coding best practices.

Prepare basic documentation for assigned tasks.

Learn and adapt to new technologies quickly.
jobs.requirements:
Undergraduate in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.

Basic knowledge of Java, JavaScript, or similar programming languages.

Familiarity with frameworks like React, React Native, or Spring Boot is an added advantage.

Good problem-solving skills and willingness to learn.

Ability to work in a team and follow guidance.

Strong communication skills.
